Name: switch_tag

Notes: Graphical cultures are found in/Europa Universalis IV/common/graphicalculturetype.txt.

Name: override_country_name

Name: restore_country_color

Name: clear_saved_name
Parameters: <key>The name key to clear.
Description: Clears a saved name key.
Notes: Use this after using the saved name in an effect.

Name: change_innovativeness
Parameters: <int>The amount of innovativeness added.

Name: complete_mission
Parameters: <key>The identifier of the mission.

Notes: Mission rewards are not given when using this effect. Instead, the mission is simply marked as complete. It will count towards any missions that require it, and it will count as completed in themission_completedtrigger.

Name: swap_non_generic_missions
Parameters: yesBoolean.
Description: Reloads the mission tree. Useful for flag-based mission trees.

Parameters: <int>The amount of power to scale and then subtract.

Name: mil_power_cost
Parameters: <int>The amount of power to scale and then subtract.
Description: Scales the amount with the power cost modifier, then takesmilitary powerfrom the current scope.

Name: remove_country
Parameters: yesBoolean

Name: play_sound
Parameters: <identifier>
Description: Plays a sound file.
Notes: Sound names are found in/Europa Universalis IV/sound/all_sounds.asset.

Name: add_years_of_income
Parameters: <float>The amount of income to add or subtract.
Description: Adds ducats equal to the years of income defined.

Name: add_treasury
Parameters: <int>The amount of ducats to add or subtract.

Name: add_inflation
Parameters: <float>The amount of inflation to add or subtract.
Description: Adds inflation to the current scope.

Name: add_mercantilism
Parameters: <int>The amount of mercantilism to add or subtract.
Description: Adds mercantilism to the current scope.

Name: add_owned_provinces_development_ducats
Parameters: multiplier = <int>age_multiplier = <int>trigger = <scope>custom_tooltip = <string>

Parameters: <int>The value to change to.

Name: raise_war_taxes
Parameters: yesBoolean

Description: Grants the current scope immediate manpower based on the manpower generation of the specified provinces over the specified duration.

Description: Grants the current scope immediate sailors based on the sailor generation of the specified provinces over the specified duration.

Notes: No effect if Absolutism isn't active.

Description: IfDharma is active, removes a government reform. If this reform was not in the highest achieved reform tier, the country can pick a new reform for free.

Name: change_government_reform_progress
Parameters: <int>The amount of reform progress to add or subtract.
Description: Adds reform progress to the current scope.

Parameters: <int>The amount of legitimacy to add or subtract.<scope>The amount of legitimacy to add or subtract, taking the value from the scope's current value.
Description: Adds legitimacy to the current scope.
Notes: No effect if not a governmentmonarchy.

Description: Adds republican tradition to the current scope.
Notes: No effect if not a government usingrepublic.

Name: add_scaled_republican_tradition
Parameters: <int>The amount of republican tradition to add or subtract.

Name: add_devotion
Parameters: <int>The amount of devotion to add or subtract.

Name: add_horde_unity
Parameters: <int>The amount of horde unity to add or subtract.
Description: Adds horde unity to the current scope.
Notes: No effect if not a government usingnomad.

Name: add_meritocracy
Parameters: <int>The amount of meritocracy to add or subtract.
Description: Adds meritocracy to the current scope.
Notes: No effect if not a government usinghas_meritocracy.

Name: set_meritocracy
Parameters: <int>The amount of meritocracy to set.
Description: Sets the current meritocracy for the current scope.
Notes: No effect if not a government usinghas_meritocracy.

Name: add_militarised_society
Parameters: <int>The amount of militarisation to add or subtract.
Description: Adds militarisation to the current scope.
Notes: No effect if not a government usingmilitarised_society.

Name: add_revolutionary_zeal
Parameters: <int>The amount of revolutionary zeal to add or subtract.
Description: Adds revolutionary zeal to the current scope.
Notes: No effect if not a government usingrevolutionary zeal.

Name: add_tribal_allegiance
Parameters: <int>The amount of tribal allegiance to add or subtract.
Description: Adds tribal allegiance to the current scope.
Notes: No effect if not a government usingtribal_federation_mechanic.

Parameters: <scope>Adopts the government reform progress from the target country scope.

Notes: Used when the Papal States is released.

Name: change_statists_vs_orangists

Parameters: <int>The amount of swing towards statists or monarchists.
Description: Changes the Monarchist-Statist balance.
Notes: Positive moves towards Monarchist, negative moves towards Statists. In percent form.

Name: change_government
Parameters: <government>The government to change to.
Description: Changes the government of the current scope.
Notes: Governments are found in/Europa Universalis IV/common/governments/*.txt.
Version Added: 1.1 (1.28.3 - will now always refund reform progress)

Name: set_government_rank
Parameters: <int>The rank to change to.

Name: dissolve_parliament

Notes: Only effects governments withhas_parliament.

Name: reinstate_parliament
Parameters: yesBoolean.
Description: Re-enables the Parliament mechanic afterdissolve_parliament.
Notes: Only effects governments withhas_parliament.

Parameters: <yes>/<no>Boolean.

Name: cancel_current_debate
Parameters: yesBoolean.
Description: Cancels the current debate in parliament, allowing a new debate to be started.

Name: remove_enacted_issue
Parameters: yesBoolean.
Description: Removes the currently enacted parliament issue, allowing a new debate to be started.

Name: enact_issue
Parameters: <identifier>The parliament issue to enact.
Description: Enacts the parliament issue and skips the whole process of debating.
Notes: Parliament issues can be found incommon/parliament_issues.

Name: add_fervor

Name: add_karma
Parameters: <int>The amount of karma to add or subtract.

Parameters: <int>The amount of karma to set.

Description: Adds a Center of Reformation for the defined religion in the current province scope.

Name: remove_reform_center
Parameters: <religion>The religion to use.
Description: Removes the Center of Reformation for the defined religion in the current province scope.

Name: set_in_empire
Parameters: yes / noBoolean.
Description: Places the current province scope in the Holy Roman Empire.

Name: add_institution_embracement
Parameters: which = <institution>The institution to add to.value = <int>The amount of embracement to add or subtract.
Description: Adds institution embracement progress for the defined institution in the current province scope.
Notes: The defined institution must be enabled for the owner of the province first.

Name: reset_golden_age
Parameters: yes / noBoolean.
Description: Allows the country to click the golden age button again.
Notes: No effect if the country is already in golden age.

Name: extend_golden_age
Parameters: <months>
Description: Extends the current golden age by X months.
Notes: No effect if the country is not in a golden age.

Name: add_nationalism
Parameters: <int>The amount to add or subtract.
Description: Adds Nationalism to the current province scope.

Name: add_unrest
Parameters: <int>The amount to add or subtract.
Description: Adds Local Unrest to the current province scope.
Notes: Appears underBase Unrest.

Name: create_native
Parameters: <int>The multiplier to use.
Description: Spawns (native population * multiplier) natives in the current province scope, rounded up to nearest 1k stack.
Notes: Only useful in colonies; will immediately disappear in cities or uncolonized provinces.

Name: create_pirate
Parameters: <int>The size to use.
Description: Spawns pirates in the current province scope.
Notes: Only spawnable in sea zones and land provinces with ports.

Name: create_revolt
Parameters: <int>The size to use.
Description: Spawns the most likely rebel type in the current province scope.

Name: <rebel type>
Parameters: <int>The size to use.
Description: Spawns the defined rebel type in the current province scope.
Notes: Rebel types found in/Europa Universalis IV/common/rebel_types/*.txt.

Name: spawn_rebels
Parameters: type = <type>The size type to use.size = <int>The size to use.culture = <culture> / <scope>Optional. The culture the rebels belong to.religion = <religion> / <scope>Optional. The religion the rebels belong to.unrest = <int>Optional. Adds this amount of unrest to the province the rebels spawn in.win = yesOptional. Changes control of the province the rebels spawn in to the rebels.friend = <scope>Optional. Associate a country with the rebels.leader = <string>Optional. Assigns the rebel leader a specific name. Can useset_saved_name.leader_dynasty = <string>Optional. Assigns the rebel leader a specific dynasty.female = yesOptional. Makes the rebel leader female.use_heir_as_leader = yesOptional. Makes the owner's heir the rebel leader. Removes heir.use_consort_as_leader = yesOptional. Makes the owner's consort the rebel leader. Removes consort.separatists_target = <scope>Optional. Associates the Rebels with a specific target country.estate = <estate>Optional. Associates the Rebels with a specific estate.as_if_faction = yesOptional. Makes the Rebel size scale with its associated estate.should_take_capital = yesOptional. Forces the rebels to always try and take the capital.
Description: Spawns the defined rebels in the current province scope.
Notes: Rebel types found in/Europa Universalis IV/common/rebel_types/*.txt.

Name: create_colony
Parameters: <int>The initial size of the colony.
Description: Starts a colony belonging to the owner of the ROOT province scope.

Name: add_colonysize
Parameters: <int>The amount of settlers to add.
Description: Adds settlers to the current province scope if a colony.

Name: multiply_colonysize
Parameters: <float>The multiplier to use.
Description: Multiplies the settler count in the current province scope if a colony.

Name: add_siberian_construction
Parameters: <int>The initial size of the colony.
Description: Starts a siberian colony in the current province scope.

Name: change_native_ferocity
Parameters: <int>The amount to add or subtract.
Description: Adds to the Native Ferocity within an uncolonized province.

Name: change_native_hostileness
Parameters: <int>The amount to add or subtract.
Description: Adds to the Native Hostileness within an uncolonized province.

Name: change_native_size
Parameters: <int>The amount to add or subtract.
Description: Adds to the amount of natives within an uncolonized province.

Name: discover_country
Parameters: <scope>The country that gains vision.
Description: The defined scope gains vision over the current province scope.
Notes: Best used within areas, regions, etc. to add vision.

Name: undiscover_country
Parameters: <scope>The country that loses vision.
Description: The defined scope loses vision over the current province scope.
Notes: Best used within areas, regions, etc. to remove vision.

Name: native_policy
Parameters: <type>The type of Native Policy to set.
Description: Changes the current scope's native policy to X.
Notes: Note when used within a trigger scope this will instead check if the country has the specific native policy active.

Name: add_claim
Parameters: <scope>The country that gains the claim.
Description: The defined scope gains a claim on the current province scope.

Name: add_core
Parameters: <scope>The country that gains the core.
Description: The defined scope gains a core on the current province scope.

Name: add_core_construction
Parameters: yesBoolean.speed = <float>The speed percentage of the base coring speed to use.cost = <float>The cost percentage of the base coring cost to use.
Description: Starts core construction in the current province scope, for the current owner.Second instance starts core construction at double the speed and full coring cost.
Notes: Minimum core construction time is 1 month

Name: add_permanent_claim
Parameters: <scope>The country that gains the permanent claim.
Description: The defined scope gains a permanent claim on the current province scope.

Name: add_territorial_core
Parameters: <scope>The country that gains the territorial core.
Description: The defined scope gains a territorial core on the current province scope.

Name: cede_province
Parameters: <scope>The country that gains ownership.
Description: The defined scope gains ownership of the current province scope.
Notes: previous_ownercan be used to cede ownership to the last previous owner of a province. If you're using an event target, and the event target points to an uncolonized province, this province will become uncolonized.

Name: change_controller
Parameters: <scope>The country that gains control.
Description: The defined scope gains control over the current province scope.
Notes: Control here means occupation, not ownership.

Name: decolonize
Parameters: <scope>The province that gets decolonized.
Description: The current scope is decolonized.
Notes: Can also accept province IDs.

Name: remove_claim
Parameters: <scope>The country that loses their claim.
Description: The defined scope loses their claim on the current province scope.
Notes: Works for both types of claims.

Name: remove_core
Parameters: <scope>The country that loses their core.
Description: The defined scope loses their core on the current province scope.

Name: remove_territorial_core
Parameters: <scope>The country that loses their territorial core.
Description: The defined scope loses their territorial core on the current province scope.

Name: kill_leader
Parameters: <type>The leader type to kill.nameis the specific leader name to target.
Description: Kills a leader in the current province scope if they match the type used.
Notes: Only works if the leader is assigned to a unit that is stationed in the current province.Possible types:generaladmiralconquistadorexplorerrandom<leader name>

Name: kill_units
Parameters: who = <scope>Optional. Which country scopes should be affected.type = <type>Optional. Which type of units that should be affected.amount = <int>Optional. The specific amount to kill.
Description: Kills units following the defined parameters in the current province scope.
Notes: In thewhoparameter, you can useenemy,ownerandcontroller.When used with no parameters, will kill all units within the current province scope.Possible types:infantrycavalryartilleryheavy_shiplight_shipgalleytransport<unit_name>

Name: add_unit_construction
Parameters: type = <type>Which type of unit to build.amount = <int>The amount to build.speed = <float>The speed percentage of the base unit construction speed to use.cost = <float>The cost percentage of the base unit construction cost to use.mercenary = yesOptional. Makes the constructed units mercenaries.
Description: Constructs the defined units in the current province scope.
Notes: Possible types:infantrycavalryartilleryheavy_shiplight_shipgalleytransport<unit_name>

Name: build_to_forcelimit
Parameters: <type> = <float>The type is any of the base unit types. The value is the percentage of forcelimit.
Description: Builds the defined units as a percentage of the owner's forcelimit in the current province scope.
Notes: 1 is equal to 100% of the owner's forcelimit.Possible types:infantrycavalryartilleryheavy_shiplight_shipgalleytransport<unit_name>

Name: remove_loot
Parameters: who = <scope>The country scope that receives the loot.amount = <int>The amount of loot to take.
Description: Removes loot from the current province scope and grants it to the defined country scope.
Notes: Thewhoparameter acceptsenemy, which distributes the loot to all current enemies of the province owner.

Name: change_siege
Parameters: <int>The process adjustment to add or subtract.
Description: Changes the siege progress in the current province scope.

Name: clear_rebels
Parameters: yesBoolean
Description: Clears all rebels in the current province scope.

Name: recall_merchant
Parameters: <scope>The country scope to use.
Description: Recalls a placed merchant in the current tradenode province scope.
Notes: Only works when the current province scope is the location of a tradenode center.

Name: add_trade_node_income
Parameters: <int>The amount to add or subtract.
Description: Gives money to the country based on its trade income in the node.
Notes: Only works when the current province scope is the location of a tradenode center.

Name: add_trade_modifier
Parameters: who = <scope>The country scope that receives the modifier.duration = <days>The duration of the modifier.power = <float>The amount of trade power to add or subtract.key = <string>The key to display as the modifier in the tooltip.
Description: Adds a trade modifier for the defined country scope in the current tradenode province scope.
Notes: Can be added to any province within a tradenode.

Name: remove_trade_modifier
Parameters: who = <scope>The country scope that has the trade modifier.name = <string>The trade modifier to remove.
Description: Removes a trade modifier for the defined country scope in the current tradenode province scope.

Name: add_to_trade_company
Parameters: <scope>The country scope to use.
Description: Adds province to scopes trade company.will remove state first if it exists.
Notes: Will remove state first if it exists.

Name: add_trade_company_investment
Parameters: investment = <investment_key>The investment to make.investor = <scope>The country investing.
Description: Adds a trade company investment in the provinces area.
Notes: investment keys are found in common/tradecompany_investments

Name: center_of_trade
Parameters: <int>Center of trade level.
Description: Creates a center of trade in the province. Only works if there is no existing center of trade.

Name: add_center_of_trade_level
Parameters: <int>Amount to increase center of trade level.
Description: Increases the level of a center of trade in the province. A negative number decreases the level of the center of trade.
